name: dod_camera
desc: DoD Camera - a special version of the trigger_camera. It is used in Day of Defeat to create "cut scenes", where the camera takes over the view of players to show them some thing in the game.

name: dod_capture_area
desc:
Capture Area - this is an area in a map that a player (or players) on a team need to occupy to capture. A few notes on this entity...
  • It takes time to capture an area. The players on a team must remain in the capture area for a set amount of time to capture.]
  • It can require more than one player to capture an area. For example, the bridge flag in the map dod_anzio requires two players to capture.]
  • It can be set to require a player to be carrying a certain object (dod_object) to capture an area.]

properties.name: area_allies_breakcap
properties.desc: Target when allies cap is broken

properties.name: area_axis_breakcap
properties.desc: Target when axis cap is broken

properties.name: target
properties.desc: Target. If you put the name of a dod_control_point (flag) here, then when the dod_capture_area is captured, the flag will change ownership to whoever has captured it.

name: dod_control_point
desc:
Control Point
This is the "flag" entity for territory capture maps.

properties.name: point_default_owner
properties.desc: Default Owner of the control point

properties.name: point_hud_icon_allies
properties.desc: Hud icon when Allies own point

properties.name: point_hud_icon_axis
properties.desc: Hud icon when Axis own point

properties.name: point_hud_icon_neutral
properties.desc: Hud icon when noone owns point

name: dod_control_point_master
desc:
Control Point Master
Every DoD map with capture points must have one dod_control_point_master. It should be given a group name, and that same group name given to all dod_control_point entities in the map.

name: dod_location
desc:
Location
These are used to give locations on a map a name. If a player puts %l (lower case L) in their "say" text, the name of the closest location or dod_control_point will be put in it's place.

name: dod_object
desc:
Object Objective

An object is an item that players can pick up by touching. Examples might be a satchel charge that a player needs to take to some target to explode, or some documents that must be captured by picking them up and returning them to some location.

Objects are typically associated with either a dod_capture_area or dod_object_goal - entities that can be set to trigger when a player carrying a specific object brings it to some location.

properties.name: object_hud_sprite
properties.desc: Sprite to show on HUD if carried

properties.name: object_player_sprite
properties.desc: Sprite to show above player if carried

name: dod_object_goal
desc:
Object Capturepoint

This is an area that can be triggered by a player carrying a specific dod_object. For example, it might be where a player must return captured documents to trigger some event.

properties.name: capobj_hud_sprite
properties.desc: Sprite to show on HUD if in zone without object

name: dod_point_relay
desc:
Capture Relay

A dod_point_relay can be used to trigger a flag to be "owned" by one team or another. The triggering event can be any kind of trigger. Think of it like an env_render for dod_control_points - a way for you to explicitly set the ownership of a flag from some trigger event.

properties.name: dod_relay_team
properties.desc: Relay triggers point with which team

name: dod_preround
desc:
Pre-Round Trigger
Experimental. Use at your own discression.

properties.name: alliesloose
properties.desc: Trigger if allies lost last round

properties.name: allieswin
properties.desc: Trigger if allies won last round

properties.name: axisloose
properties.desc: Trigger if axis lost last round

properties.name: axiswin
properties.desc: Trigger if axis won last round

properties.name: draw
properties.desc: Trigger if last round was draw

name: dod_round_timer
desc:
DoD Timer
Use this if you want to have a timed map round. It can be set to trigger some event after a certain amount of time, with all players optionally seeing the time left on their HUD. Very useful to trigger a dod_point_relay to make a flag capture happen for example.

name: dod_score_ent
desc: Used to trigger the "end" of a round, award points to a winning team, and possibly move on to a new map. Usually triggered by a dod_control_point_master or dod_timer upon round end because one team wins.

name: dod_trigger_sandbag
desc:
Sandbag Trigger
A brush based entity used to mark an area where a player can stand and deploy their machine gun or other deployable gun. Often placed in front of window ledges and sandbags.

Idea height of the "platform" for deployment should be about 44 units.

name: env_model
desc: New alternative to cyclers. It is the prefered entity to use when placing models in your map.

name: func_breakable
desc:
Breakable Object

Note the special new features the breakable has in DoD. It can be set to break when a player carrying a certain object touches it, break when shot by a bazooka/panzerschrek/PIAT, or only from grenade explosion damage.

properties.name: capobj_hud_sprite
properties.desc: Sprite to show on HUD if in zone without object

name: func_friction
desc: Surface with a change in friction

properties.name: spawnorigin
properties.desc: X Y Z - Move here after lighting

name: func_tank
desc:
Brush Gun Turret

Note: In DoD, this entity can be set to shoot at only one team. This is perfect for creating spawn protecting "turret" like guns.

properties.name: fadein
properties.desc: Fade in Time (or character scan time)

name: info_doddetect
desc: DoD Gamerules  Every DoD map should have one of these. It allows you to set many different core behaviours for a map.

properties.name: detect_points_allieseliminated
properties.desc: Points given for wiping out Allies team

properties.name: detect_points_axiseliminated
properties.desc: Points given for wiping out Axis team

properties.name: detect_target_timerexpired
properties.desc: Target when the built-in timer expires

properties.name: detect_timer_team
properties.desc: Which team wins when timer expires

name: particle_shooter
desc: Particle Shooter  The new entity for DoD that lets you create smoke and other great effects. Huge potential for things with it.

name: trigger_auto
desc: AutoTrigger  Note: In DoD, this entity now will trigger at the beginning of EVERY round, not just the first time a map is loaded. This should make having things trigger at the beginning of the map much easier.

name: trigger_once
desc:
The trigger_once entity allows you to trigger an event, but only once.

usage

The trigger_once entity allows an event to be triggered when the player passes through the trigger_once area (the trigger_once area is defined by the brush it is assigned to). The only thing you need to fill in for this entity is its Target field. The only other key worth modifying is the Delay key which causes the trigger to not activate its events for a specified number of seconds.

In Day of Defeat, this entity has been modified to trigger once during each round, rather than the very first time a map is run. This behaviour can be overridden.
